Great #LHC physics run overnight with 8 hours of stable beams. Now going in to beam injection and extraction studies.
#LHC is now ramping down. This closes the first physics fill of protons at 7 TeV.Thanks for following and goodbye for today.
Experiments have half million events! More than three hours of stable and colliding beams. WOW!
Experiments have already recorded thousands of events! We had more than 1 hour of stable and colliding beams
The Press Release is now available: http://bit.ly/9A2Me8
Now we have stable colliding beams-first time ever at this energy!
Live webcast: http://bit.ly/aQftoi
Experiments are collecting their first physics data - historic moment here! Watch the webcast, look at the photos - all live!
Nature does it all the time with cosmic rays (and with higher energy) but this is the first time this is done in Laboratory!!
First time in the history!!!!!!!!!!!! World record!!!!!!!!
Experiment have seen collisions!!!!!!!!!!!
Now stabilizing the beams
Collapsed!!
Final sequence for collapsing is starting!
Beams will be collapsed soon! Then a new stabilization will be needed before experiments will be able to observe the first collisions.
Operators are stabilizing the beams... yes, we'll attempt to collide them soon!
3,5 TeV at the #LHC... Adjusting the beams now.
The ramp is successfully completed! Beams are now accelerated to 3.5 TeV, the highest energy! Preparing for collisions now!!
3 TeV at the #LHC. Almost 3,5 TeV...
Physicists hold their breath in the control room of the #LHC
Half of today's energy at the #LHC: 1,75 TeV! All lights are green!
Ramping up now!
Beams look really good this time. Preparing for energy ramp!
Beams are in again! Now, cross your fingers! We want to go for collisions here!
Live webcast restarting at 12:00 - Twitter is always on!
Unfortunately beam 2 was no good...we had to dump it...going for new injection
Beams are in!
Preparing for new injection from SPS, the smaller accelerator that brings particles to the LHC.
New analysis showed that the magnetic coupling of the main circuits in SPS and the LHC caused the problem and not an electric perturbation
Siemko says:an electric perturbation,seen also by other accelerators,made the protection system stop the magnets.The machine is restarting.
On webcast soon: A. Siemko to explain the cause of the beam loss. http://bit.ly/aQftoi
It's all live! New photos: http://bit.ly/dfTGiF http://bit.ly/b5qbSu http://bit.ly/dvYahz - Watch the webcast http://bit.ly/aQftoi
Experts are still investigating the situation. It looks like the problem is with the machine protection system. We'll keep you posted
Beams lost again...operators will need to study the situation now.
The energy ramp has to happen slowly. It will easily take 30-40 minutes to get to the highest peak.
The energy ramp has started - up to 3.5 TeV now!
The live webcast has started! Follow it at http://webcast.cern.ch/lhcfirstphysics/
Beams are in-operators have set the path to collisions. However, stable beams are needed before attempting the energy ramp again.
A new injection of particles into the LHC has just started
Operators are discussing the procedure for the new injection and ramp. See http://bit.ly/diGcFS
Operators are ramping the energy in the machine without beams. See photo http://bit.ly/9TnMr4
We will follow live the first high-energy collisions at the LHC: stay tuned!
Hello, this is now Antonella speaking live from the CERN Control Centre
Beams in! Optimising the beams before ramping <- Ramping means increasing the energy - This takes time...
All lights are green. Injection of beams into the #LHC is being prepared.
Live from the CERN Control Center - Arnaud is speaking. First attempt for collisions may take time. We will keep you up to date...
Good morning. #LHC spent a good night with two stable beams at 3,5 TeV each. Next fill for collisions!

A very good weekend for the LHC:  well over 1 million collisions at 900 GeV and about 50 000 collisions at 2.36 TeV
#LHC has started higher intensity running at 450 GeV. Target is 1 miilion events for the experiments.
LHC beam commissioning continues, aiming towards higher intensities at 450 GeV.
Last night the LHC accelerated both beams to 1.18 TeV with 2 bunches per beam for the first time.
LHC has started running with stable beams at 450 GeV (4 bunches per beam). Collision data is being recorded by the experiments.
LHC beam-commissioning progressing, with first "multi-bunch" beams last night (2 bunches per beam).
LHC running, with beam-commissioning under way again since yesterday evening, following power cut on CERN main site
The LHC has run with solenoid magnets in the ALICE, ATLAS and CMS detectors turned up to full field.
#LHC set world record for beam energy last night. Twin beams circulated at 1.18 TeV, for more see http://bit.ly/6zOkVR
A new record. Both beams in LHC reach 1.18 TeV at 00:42 on 30 November.

TWO BEAMS ARE CURRENTLY CIRCULATING IN THE LHC! #CERN #LHC
Good morning from CERN. Over three days, the LHC has had two beams circulating with good lifetimes. It's a good solid start. #CERN #LHC

RT @CMSexperiment: LHC Beam 2 restarting after a long pause. One shot seen in CMS!
#CMS #LHC #CERN
That was a good night for the LHC with periods of quiet beam. Next step - same again for the other beam.
Thanks for following us, and for all the support. We’ll keep you posted if anything interesting happens.  http://ow.ly/EkbB #CERN #LHC
This has been a great 24 hours for the LHC. Now the systems commissioning begins, so we’ll be tweeting less often for a while. #CERN #LHC
Nice animation of a beam splash in the LHCb experiment. Look at their page: http://ow.ly/EjUB #CERN #LHC
Welcome back beam 1! This is the clockwise direction:Point 2(ALICE experiment)->3->4->5(CMS)->6->7->8(LHCb)->Point1 (ATLAS).Its' circulating
Machine ready for injection of beam 1, the clockwise beam #CERN #LHC
Were you looking for an animation of the various steps I am describing? From bottle to bang: http://ow.ly/Ej0b #CERN #LHC
Yes,the trick is the concentration of energy in tiny tiny tiny tiny particles.Now,let's move to step 5: particles enter the LHC #CERN #LHC
RT @yschutz: ALICE experiment records splashes as well! http://ow.ly/EiT3 #CERN #LHC
Back to450GeV,the extraction energy from SPS.Crushing a nut easily involves more than 450GeV of your energy.So,where is the trick?#CERN #LHC
Live update on restart of beams: the LHC is preparing for injection from the SPS.  #CERN #LHC
4 step: protons are sent to SPS, the last circle before the LHC.A few turns to increase the energy up to 450GeV. Do you know how much is it?
3rd step: protons are sent to circular accelerators (PSB and PS): it's were bunches are prepared. The energy increases. And then..#CERN #LHC
In reply to some tweets:there is no issue with any single dipole at LHC.Teams are simply improving the calibration of the protection system.
2nd step: protons are accelerated in a LINAC=linear accelerator. Their energy starts to increase. And then... #CERN #LHC
Some info about how we make beams for the LHC:protons are produced by stripping electrons from hydrogen atoms.This is easy.Then.. #CERN #LHC
it's 12:24 in Geneva, operators are checking various parameters in the injection chain and the LHC #CERN #LHC
Hello everybody, this is Antonella tweeting from the CERN CCC. The situation is calm here, beams are not expected before 2 pm. #CERN #LHC
Arnaud is going to sleep now and says goodbye! Antonella will take over keeping in touch with you guys. #CERN #LHC
Some settings are being done. Stay tuned. And be ready for new beams of protons circulating at almost the speed of light! #CERN #LHC
So no collisions planned yet. We are not in a hurry with the secrets of the Universe :) Just a short respite for the Higgs boson! #CERN #LHC
Joking :) We will go asap to circulating beam again to do some measurements, refine and check things.   #CERN #LHC
Meeting just finished. Do you want to know what is happening? #CERN #LHC
9AM meeting is starting... #CERN #LHC
The night's team is gone to sleep.Thanks to them! The new team is taking over. Meeting at 9AM to discuss the next step(s)... #CERN #LHC
Thank you all for the good wishes and congratulations' messages! A new foggy day is starting at CERN, but an exciting one! #CERN #LHC

This is just quiet here. Everything runs smoothly!  #CERN #LHC

Not collisions yet. But the LHCb experiment is recording its first "splash" of particles!  #CERN #LHC
Check back tomorrow morning. We will be tweeting again. Bonne nuit from Geneva!
Ladies and Gentlemen, it's almost time to go to bed. The LHC is up and running regularly Operators are adjusting and testing obedient beams.
Regular operations with beam 2: it's dumped every 100 000 turns and then re-injected again. #LHC #CERN
New photos available now. They include the flying hats http://ow.ly/E9OG
Beam captured=kept in orbit #LHC #CERN
11 000 turns per second - beam 2 is turning since many seconds. We let you make the calculation ;-) #LHC #CERN
Beam 2 captured! #LHC #CERN
150 turns for beam 2 - cavities on stand by #LHC #CERN
New photos of completion of second circle will be available in about 15 minutes #LHC #CERN
Cavities are ready to attempt capturing beam 2 #LHC #CERN
First 2 turns of beam 2 #LHC #CERN
Second circle completed!! Hats are up on air in the CERN CCC (photos to follow) #LHC #CERN
Still communicating with the injection chain #LHC #CERN
LHC is one of the trending topics of Twitter! #LHC #CERN
At point 1 (ATLAS experiment) - only one sector to go  #LHC #CERN
It's a point 2 now #LHC #CERN
Improving beam quality before going any further - #LHC #CERN
Beam 2 to sector 3 - done! #LHC #CERN
Doing more shots to CMS now - then keep on going #LHC #CERN
Beam 2 at point 5 - half way round again but anticlockwise this time #LHC #CERN
To point 6 and straight to point 5 (CMS experiment) #LHC #CERN
Welcome beam 2! One sector done. #LHC #CERN
The door to the LHC is now open #LHC #CERN
Still preparing beams for injection but stay tuned. Did you know that there are more than 9000 magnets in the LHC? #LHC #CERN
Preparing magnets for injection of beam 2. Particles arrive to the LHC from the smaller accelerators through beam transfer lines  #LHC #CERN
We now go for beam 2
Now it goes fast: 100000 turns!
We have captured it! First circulating beam of 2009!
Cavities are switched on! We will wait for a good beam quality before attempting to capture it
Decision was made to first capture beam 1 and then go for injection of beam 2. To do so, we will soon switch on the cavities.
Beam 1 has made more than 500 turns of the LHC. The beam orbit is improving fast.
New photos available. They include the very first moments of the completion of the first circle. http://ow.ly/E7nI
Teams are working to improve beam quality before injecting in the anticlockwise direction. Beam 1 has made several turns around the LHC.
We will start injecting the anticlockwise beam in the second ring and then go step by step again. New photos will soon be available
We have completed the ring!
Just one sector to go now!
Beam is at point 8 - two sectors to go!
Beam has just arrived at Point 7 - just three more sectors to go!
Look at the first photographs from the CERN Control Centre http://ow.ly/E6lp
Beam has passed point 5 (the CMS experiment) and arrived at point 6.
A clockwise beam has just gone half way round the LHC.
